BARS

SARASOTA

BACALAO SPORTS GRILL BAR: Karaoke, 6:30 p.m. Thurs. / Hip-hop, 10 p.m. Thurs. / George W. Carroll Jazz Quartet, 6 p.m. Fri. / Caribbean Nite with Democracy, 10 p.m. Fri. / Shift Change, 7 p.m. Sat. / FJ One, 10 p.m. Sat. / Jazz Mania with Tom Barrett, 5:30 p.m. Sun. / Texas Pokers, 7 p.m. Mon. / Jazz Metro Connection, 7 p.m. Tues. / Sarasota Jazz Project, 6:30 p.m. June 30 / Drag show, 9 p.m. Wed. / George W. Carroll big band, 6 p.m. first Sunday of the month. 1100 N. Tuttle Ave. 366-0157

THE BAR OUT BACK: Free jukebox, Fri. / Free pool, Sun., Tues. 5643 Clark Road. 924-7676

THE BEACH CLUB: 10 p.m. shows. Kettle of Fish, Thurs. / Sweet Spot, Fri. / The Untouchables, Sat. / Reggae Sunday with Roadblock, Sun. / Service Industry Night with Ben Hammond, Mon. / Work in Progress, Tues. / Ladies night with DJs Jimi-O and Kev, Wed. 5151 Ocean Blvd., Siesta Key. 349-6311; beachclubsiestakey.com

SHOWS

EDITOR'S NOTE: Contact venues for times and ticket prices.

SARASOTA

SARASOTA BLUES FESTIVAL: Nov. 6. Elvin Bishop, Trombone Shorty & Orleans Avenue, The Tommy Castro Band, Moreland & Arbuckle, Jake Haldenwang, The All-Stars Band. Ed Smith Stadium, 2700 12th St. $22/$27; children free. Gates open at 11 a.m.; music starts at noon. 377-3279; sarasotabluesfest.com

SARASOTA BLUES FEST KICKOFF PARTY: The Lee Boys & Ben Prestage, 8 p.m. July 31. Holley Hall, 709 N. Tamiami Trail. $15. Tickets available at Rocketman, Fogt's Music, Sarasota Emporium. wslr.org

VINYL MUSIC FESTIVAL: Featuring Micro, Paul Mendez, Scooter & Lavelle, Shawn Rudnick, Drager, Madame Malixa. July 15-18. Sarasota Municipal Auditorium and other venues. $40-$80. 928-9269; vinylfestival.com

ATTRACTIONS

SARASOTA

BIG CAT HABITAT & GULF COAST SANCTUARY: A safe haven for big cats, bears and other animals in need. Sunset Safari guided tour and demonstration, 6:30 p.m. Thurs.-Sat.; gate opens 6 p.m. $20; $10 age 12 and younger. 7101 Palmer Blvd. 371-6377; BigCatHabitat.org

THE CHILDREN'S GARDEN: Whimsical garden with sculptures, mazes, pirate ship, hidden treasures, dress-up room, acting stage, etc. Drop-Off Saturdays for ages 5-11 with activities, games, stories, 10 a.m.-noon Sat. Call for prices and reservations. Open 10 a.m.-5 p.m. daily. $10; $9 age 55 and older; $5 ages 3-12; free under age 3. 1670 10th Way. 330-1711; sarasotachildrensgarden.com

CROWLEY MUSEUM & NATURE CENTER: Nature trails and a boardwalk offer a close-up view of five natural Florida habitats in this 185-acre preserve. Self-guided walks. Blacksmithing demonstrations, first Sat. of the month. Open 8 a.m.-2 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 7-11 a.m. Sun. Closed Fourth of July. $8; $3 ages 5-12; free under age 5 and members. 16405 Myakka Road, 13 miles east of I-75 and Fruitville Road. 322-1000; cmncfl.org

LEGACY TRAIL: 10-mile trail follows former CSX railroad corridor from just south of Sarasota on McIntosh Road to Venetian Waterway Park in Venice. Open for walking, inline skating and bicycling. Features wildlife habitat and undeveloped areas. Parking at trailheads along the route. Open 6 a.m.-dusk daily. 861-7245; legacytrailfriends.org

MOTE AQUARIUM: Sharks, manatees, sea turtles, sea horses, jellyfish and more. Two touch exhibits allow children to handle sea creatures and to pet stingrays.. $17; $16 age 65 and older; $12 ages 4-12; under 4 and members free; free grades K-12 with a paid parent ticket (one child per parent) and report card showing an "A" in a science class through July 31. 388-4441; mote.org

MYAKKA RIVER STATE PARK: Bird walks, picnic areas, historic cabins, camping areas, fishing holes and more take visitors back in time to Old Florida. Open 8 a.m.-sunset daily. $6 a vehicle for two to eight people. 13208 S.R. 72 (nine miles east of I-75). 361-6511; myakkariver.org

OLD MIAKKA PRESERVE: 129-acre preserve with more than four miles of hiking trails takes its name from a historical rural community. Open daily 7:30 a.m.-8 p.m. April-Oct.; 7:30 a.m.-6 p.m. Nov.-March. 251 Myakka Road (eastern end of Fruitville Road). 861-5000

OSCAR SCHERER STATE PARK: Scrub jay habitat, hiking, bicycling, canoeing and kayaking. Open 8 a.m.-sunset. $5 vehicle (two to eight people); $4 single-occupant vehicle; $2 pedestrians, bicyclists and additional passengers. 1843 S. Tamiami Trail, Osprey. 483-5956; floridastateparks.org/oscarscherer

PHILLIPPI ESTATE PARK: 60-acre park south of downtown Sarasota. Historical Edson Keith Mansion, playground, gazebo, canoe/kayak launch, trails, fishing piers, more. Open daily. 5500 S. Tamiami Trail. 316-1309; scgov.net

SARASOTA JUNGLE GARDENS: Acres of gardens and nature trails with animals. Open 10 a.m.-5 p.m. daily. $15; $14 age 60 and older; $10 ages 3-12; free age 2 and younger. 3701 Bay Shore Road. 355-5305; sarasotajunglegardens.com

MARIE SELBY BOTANICAL GARDENS: Extensive indoor and outdoor gardens specializing in orchids, bromeliads, ferns and other exotic flora of the tropics. / Tropical 4th of July Celebration, live music and fireworks, 6–10 p.m. July 4. $18; $15 members; free age 11 and younger. / Community classes available in art, horticulture, yoga, photography, more; call or visit website for schedule. Open 10 a.m.-5 p.m. daily. $17; $6 ages 6-11; under 6 and members free. 811 S. Palm Ave. 366-5731, Ext. 236; selby.org

MANATEE

AROUND THE BEND NATURE TOURS: Guided, two-hour walking tours of preserves and parks throughout Manatee County explore nature and Florida history. See website for schedule. $15. Reserve by phone or online. 794-8773; aroundbend.com

EMERSON POINT PARK: 365-acre preserve on Snead Island in western Palmetto with prehistoric and historic sites, trails, more. Open 8 a.m.-sunset daily. 5801 17th St. W., Palmetto. 721-6885; www.mymanatee.org/conservation.html

GAMBLE MANSION PLANTATION: State historical site and Confederate memorial. Antebellum plantation home is the oldest building on Florida's west coast. Visitor center open 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Thurs.-Mon.; park open daily until sundown. Guided tours, six times daily; $6; $4 children. 3708 Patten Ave. (off U.S. 301), Ellenton, west of I-75. 723-4536; floridastateparks.org/gambleplantation

MANATEE VILLAGE HISTORICAL PARK: Explore early pioneer life in Manatee County with boat-making, turpentine production and blacksmithing. Open 9 a.m.-4:30 p.m. Mon.-Fri.; 10 a.m.-4:30 p.m. second and fourth Sat. of each month. Free. 1404 Manatee Ave. E., Bradenton. 749-7165

PALMETTO HISTORICAL PARK: A one-room schoolhouse, agricultural exhibits, Palmetto's first post office and more provide a glimpse of what life was like in the early 1900s. Open 10 a.m.-noon and 1-4 p.m. Tues.-Fri. and first and third Saturdays of the month. Guided tours available. Free. 515 10th Ave. W., Palmetto. 723-4991; manateeclerk.com/historical

ROBINSON PRESERVE: Restored coastal and wetlands habitat in 487-acre preserve. Open 8 a.m.-sunset daily. 1704 99th St. N.W., Bradenton. 748-4501, Ext. 4602; www.mymanatee.org/conservation.html

RYE PRESERVE: Four distinctive ecosystems, nature and horseback trails, historical Rye Family Cemetery on 145 acres northwest of the Lake Manatee Dam. Open 8 a.m.-sunset daily. Rye Preserve, 905 Rye Wilderness Trail, Parrish. Free. 776-0900; www.mymanatee.org/conservation.html

ENGLEWOOD

CEDAR POINT ENVIRONMENTAL PARK: 115-acre park on Lemon Bay. Marked trails; bald eagle nesting. Open daily during daylight hours. 2300 Placida Road. 475-0769; checflorida.org

TAMPA BAY

BUSCH GARDENS: Amusement park and zoo spanning 300 acres, including Jungala and Sesame Street Safari of Fun. Also features water rides, roller coasters, a marketplace and live entertainment. Hours vary. $74.95; $64.95 ages 3-9 or residents of Florida (online only). 3000 E. Busch Blvd. (S.R. 580), Tampa, 2 miles west of I-75 (Exit 54). (888) 800-5447; buschgardens.com

CRACKER COUNTRY: Living-history museum preserving Florida's rural pioneer heritage and folklife. "Discover the Past," 10 a.m.-4 p.m. first Saturday of each month. $6; $5 ages 6-12 and seniors; free age 5 and under. / "Patriotic Past," 19th-century Independence Day celebration, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. July 3. $7; $6 ages 6-12 and seniors; free age 5 and younger. At Florida State Fairgrounds, 4800 U.S. 301 N., Tampa. (813) 627-4225; (800) 345-3247; crackercountry.org

DINOSAUR WORLD: Old Florida attraction features more than 150 life-sized replicas of prehistoric creatures, picnic areas and a fossil dig. Open 9 a.m.-6 p.m. daily. $12.75; $9.75 ages 3-12; $10.75 age 60 and older. I-4, Exit 17, Plant City. (813) 717-9865; dinoworld.net

FLORIDA AQUARIUM: Three-story, glass-domed aquarium features live exhibits of Florida's ecosystem and aquatic habitats. Children's water park outdoors. Open 9:30 a.m.-5 p.m. daily. $19.95; $16.95 age 60 and older; $14.95 ages 3-12; age 2 and under free. Eco-Tours (weather permitting): $21.95; $19.95 age 60 and older; $17.95 ages 3-12; free age 2 and under. Combined: $35.95; $31.95 age 60 and older; $27.95 ages 3-12; free age 2 and under. 701 Channelside Drive, Tampa. (813) 273-4000; flaquarium.org

HIRE A PONY: Petting zoo, pony rides, hayrides, train rides, horseback riding and more. 9:30 a.m.-4:30 p.m. daily. 8005 Racetrack Road, Tampa. (813) 855-8992; hireapony.com

LOWRY PARK ZOO: Komodo dragons, rhinos, giraffes, elephants, hippos and more on display. GEICO Gecko Traveling Exhibit, through July 18. Open 9:30 a.m.-5 p.m. daily. $20.95; $18.95 age 60 and older; $15.95 ages 3-11; free age 2 and younger. River Odyssey Ecotour, $14; $13 age 60 and older; $10 ages 3-11; free age 2 and younger. Free parking. 1101 W. Sligh Ave. (813) 935-8552; lowryparkzoo.com

SCIENCE CENTER OF PINELLAS: Hands-on marine tank, wetland exhibit, 16th-century American Indian village, planetarium, native species and more. Planetarium shows, 3 p.m. Fri. Tours available. Open 1-4 p.m. Mon.-Fri. $3. 7701 22nd Ave. N., St. Petersburg. (727) 384-0027; sciencecenterofpinellas.com

SUNKEN GARDENS: St. Petersburg's "oldest living museum" features a 100-year-old botanical garden, horticultural programs and more. Open 10 a.m.-4:30 p.m. Mon.-Sat.; noon-4:30 p.m. Sun. $8; $6 age 55 and older; $4 ages 2-11; free under age 2. 1825 Fourth St. N., St. Petersburg. (727) 551-3100; stpete.org/sunken

WEEKI WACHEE SPRINGS: Old Florida attraction with live mermaid shows, animal shows, boat rides, water park and more. Open 10 a.m.-4 p.m. daily. Buccaneer Bay Water Park, open 10 a.m.-5 p.m. daily. Show park and Buccaneer Bay: $26; $12 ages 6-12; free age 5 and younger. Show park only: $13; $5 ages 6-12; free age 5 and younger. 6131 Commercial Way, Weeki Wachee. (352) 596-2062; weekiwachee.com

ORLANDO

AQUATICA: 59-acre water park across from SeaWorld. Hours vary. $47.95; $41.95 ages 3-9; $41.95 Florida residents (online only); free age 2 and under. $12 parking for cars; $15 RVs. 5800 Water Play Way. (888) 800-5447; aquaticabyseaworld.com

SEAWORLD ORLANDO: Theme park provides encounters with Shamu the killer whale, dolphins, stingrays, penguins, sharks and more. Open 9 a.m. daily; closing times vary. $78.95; $68.95 ages 3-9 and Florida residents. 7007 SeaWorld Drive (off I-4). (888) 800-5447; seaworld.com

UNIVERSAL STUDIOS/ISLANDS OF ADVENTURE: Theme park based on movies. Roller coasters, interactive rides and more. Spider-Man and his comic-book pals are in Islands of Adventure. Open 9 a.m. daily; closing times vary. $79 per park; $69 ages 3-9. (Online discounts available for Florida residents.) 1000 Universal Studios Plaza (off I-4). (407) 363-8000; universalorlando.com

WALT DISNEY WORLD: Magic Kingdom, EPCOT, Animal Kingdom, Disney-MGM Studios and more make Disney World one of the most popular attractions worldwide. Hours vary. $79 per park; $68 ages 3-9. (Discounts available for Florida residents.) Lake Buena Vista, accessible from U.S. 192 and several exits off I-4, south of Orlando. (407) 824-2222; disneyworld.disney.go.com

WET 'N WILD: Miles of water rides. Hours vary. $47.95; $41.95 ages 3-9 and age 60 and older; free under age 3; $32 Florida residents (adult or child). Half-price admission on select afternoons; times vary. 6200 International Drive (off I-4). (407) 351-1800; wetnwildorlando.com
